description.narrative: Key decision makers at national and sub-national levels in UNICEF programming states have enhanced capacities to apply a child and adolescent focused lens and establish monitoring and tracking expenditure with emphasis on two critical stages of lifecycle in budgeting cycle by 2022., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Social policies and strategies inform more effective and efficient planning, budgeting and implementation of social service programmes for reducing inequities and gender inequalities especially for the most vulnerable and marginalized children and adolescents by 2022

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Key decision makers at national and sub-national levels in UNICEF programming states have enhanced capacities to apply a child and adolescent focused lens and establish monitoring and tracking expenditure with emphasis on two critical stages of lifecycle in budgeting cycle by 2022.

description.narrative: UNICEF's evidence on public expenditure on children in past seven years in 16 states and continued advocacy efforts with the state governments led to 8 states developed the child budget statement, while 3 states have institutionalized. Financial allocation for children has increased in 8 states while other states are in the process of developing tools for allocation and expenditure analysis, methodology framework and SOPs to institutionalize the child budget in the budgetary planning. 3 states viz. Maharashtra, Jharkhand and Odisha have developed guidance and training tools, framework etc. to contribute towards gender and child responsive budgeting | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of national / state Governments that develop and disseminate budget analysis reports examining resources allocation for children (with special focus on ECD) and adolescents related programmes annually

target.value: 2020:4 states initiating, 9 states responding, 4 states achieved

actual.value: 2019:8 states have developed the child budget statement based on such analysis and 3 states have institutionalized it.

title.narrative: Number of state governments that have SoPs and protocols and used to track expenditure on outcomes for children

target.value: 2020:8 states initiating, 4 states responding, 2 states achieved

title.narrative: Number of state governments that have SoPs and protocols and used to track expenditure on outcomes for children

target.value: 2020:8 states initiating, 4 states responding, 2 states achieved

actual.value: 2019:National study analyzing expenditure on children in 16 states completed and 2 states (Bihar, UP) have developed the SOPs, online systems, templates, guidelines to support the expenditure tracking.
